niemen.title: French Invasion
niemen.info: Napoleon launches his grand Russian campaign by crossing the Niemen River with over 400,000 soldiers and around a thousand cannons. This bold move marks the definitive break with the Russian Empire and the beginning of an epic journey that would reshape the political and human landscape of Eastern Europe.
niemen.label: Invasion

vilnius.title: Vilnius Captured
vilnius.info: Facing little resistance, the French army captures Vilnius, capital of Lithuania, just four days after crossing the Niemen. The city becomes the first major logistical point of the campaign, though Napoleon soon realizes the difficulty of maintaining supplies and control over such vast territory.
vilnius.label: Vilnius

vitebsk.title: French Depot
vitebsk.info: The occupation of Vitebsk offers the Grande Armée a chance to regroup. The city is transformed into a crucial supply depot where Napoleon pauses his advance, hoping to draw the Russians into a decisive battle — one that never comes.
vitebsk.label: Recompose

smolensk.title: Smolensk Battle
smolensk.info: At Smolensk, the French finally encounter strong resistance. Though they take the city after fierce fighting, the Russians set it ablaze and withdraw, continuing their scorched-earth strategy. Victory feels hollow for Napoleon as his opponent once again escapes destruction.
smolensk.label: Battle

polotsk1.title: First Battle of Polotsk
polotsk1.info: While the main army pushes forward, a parallel clash occurs at Polotsk, where the French repel a Russian assault. The battle temporarily secures the northern flank of the invasion but signals that Russian forces are tightening their grip.
polotsk1.label: Battle

gjatsk.title: Preparing for War
gjatsk.info: At Gjatsk, the French army takes its final pause before the long-awaited confrontation. Exhausted and hungry, the soldiers brace themselves for a battle Napoleon hopes will be decisive — unaware of the horror and despair yet to come.
gjatsk.label: Recompose

shevardino.title: Shevardino Battle
shevardino.info: The fight at Shevardino serves as a bloody prelude to the Battle of Borodino. The French storm a Russian forward redoubt, sustaining and inflicting heavy losses. The skirmish foreshadows the brutal combat that lies ahead.
shevardino.label: Battle

borodino.title: Borodino Battle
borodino.info: Borodino becomes the bloodiest battle of the invasion, with over 70,000 casualties on both sides. Though technically a French victory, the human cost is staggering. Napoleon fails to destroy the Russian army, missing the chance for a decisive triumph.
borodino.label: Battle

moscow1.title: Moscow is Conquered
moscow1.info: Napoleon enters Moscow only to find the city abandoned and soon engulfed in flames. Without a formal surrender and facing dire conditions, French morale plummets. The emperor slowly realizes that taking the Russian capital does not mean winning the war.
moscow1.label: Conquista

moscow2.title: Retreat from Moscow
moscow2.info: With no peace in sight and winter approaching, Napoleon orders a retreat from Moscow. What begins as a strategic withdrawal soon descends into a logistical and human nightmare, as soldiers face hunger, frost and constant attacks.
moscow2.label: leaving

polotsk2.title: Second Battle of Polotsk
polotsk2.info: As the French retreat from Moscow, the Russians launch a coordinated assault at Polotsk. This time, the French are defeated and forced to abandon the city, further weakening the Grande Armée’s northern flank.
polotsk2.label: Battle

maloyaroslavets.title: Battle of Maloyaroslavets
maloyaroslavets.info: Attempting to take a southern route home, the French meet fierce resistance at Maloyaroslavets. Despite a tactical victory, they are forced to return along the same devastated road they used to invade, compounding their suffering.
maloyaroslavets.label: Battle

vyazma.title: Battle of Vyazma
vyazma.info: During the retreat, French forces suffer heavy losses at Vyazma due to coordinated Russian attacks. Chaos and disorganization grow, and many soldiers are captured or killed as the army’s structure unravels.
vyazma.label: Battle

krasnoi2.title: Battle of Krasnoi
krasnoi2.info: Near Krasnoi, the Russians strike a nearly fatal blow to the French rearguard. The battle results in the loss of 13,000 men and deepens the collapse of the Grande Armée, which is now in a desperate fight for survival.
krasnoi2.label: Battle

berezina.title: Battle of Berezina
berezina.info: Crossing the Berezina River becomes a hellish ordeal. Trapped between two Russian armies and freezing temperatures, thousands perish, but the remaining French forces manage to escape across hastily built bridges.
berezina.label: Battle

dec5.title: Napoleon retreats
dec5.info: Recognizing the looming disaster and fearing political instability in Paris, Napoleon leaves the army and returns to France. Command passes to his subordinates as the shattered remnants of the Grande Armée continue their retreat without their emperor.
dec5.label: Fuga

niemen2.title: End of War
niemen2.info: Amid scenes of death and ruin, the last survivors of the Grande Armée recross the Niemen River, formally ending the invasion. Of the over 400,000 men who began the campaign, only a fraction return — and Napoleon’s empire would never fully recover.
niemen2.label: Retirada
